spec.displayName: Getting Started with Red Hat Streams for Apache Kafka
spec.description: Learn how to create and set up your first Apache Kafka instance in Red Hat Streams for Apache Kafka.
prerequisites: Access to the Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka environment at https://cloud.redhat.com
spec.introduction: Welcome to the Red Hat Streams for Apache Kafka Getting Started quick start. In this quick start, youâ€™ll learn how to create and inspect a Kafka instance, create a service account to connect an application or service to the instance, and create a topic in the instance.

tasks.title: Creating a Kafka instance in Streams for Apache Kafka
tasks.description:
A Kafka instance in Streams for Apache Kafka includes a Kafka cluster, bootstrap server, and other required configurations for connecting to Kafka producer and consumer services. You can use the Streams for Apache Kafka web console to create and configure a Kafka instance for your applications or services.

Verification

  • Is the new Kafka instance listed in the instances table?

  • Is the state of the new Kafka instance shown as Ready?

tasks.title: Creating a service account to connect to a Kafka instance in Streams for Apache Kafka
tasks.description:
To connect your applications or services to a Kafka instance in the Streams for Apache Kafka web console, you must create a service account, copy and save the generated credentials, and copy and save the bootstrap server location. Red Hat Streams for Apache Kafka uses the SASL/OAUTHBEARER authentication mechanism over TLS to provide secure connections between your applications and Kafka instances. SASL/PLAIN authentication is also available for tools and libraries that do not support SASL/OAUTHBEARER, but SASL/OAUTHBEARER is recommended whenever possible. When you generate credentials for a Kafka instance, Streams for Apache Kafka creates a service account that contains the generated user name and password associated with the instance.

Prerequisites

  • You have created a Kafka instance in the Streams for Apache Kafka web console and the instance is in Ready state.

Verification

  • Did you save the bootstrap server endpoint to a secure location?

  • Did you save the client credentials to a secure location?

tasks.title: Creating a Kafka topic in Streams for Apache Kafka
tasks.description:
After you create a Kafka instance, you can create Kafka topics to start producing and consuming messages in your services.

Prerequisites

  • You have created a Kafka instance in the Streams for Apache Kafka web console and the instance is in Ready state.

Verification

  • Is the new Kafka topic listed in the topics table?

spec.conclusion: Congratulations! You successfully completed the Streams for Apache Kafka Getting Started quick start, and are now ready to use the service.
